item.title: Dan add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "There is no perfection only life" -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dan add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Two people in love, alone, isolated from the world, that's beautiful." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dan add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Living is being happy: seeing, hearing, touching, drinking, eating, urinating, defecating, diving into the water and gazing at the sky, laughing and crying." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dan add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Love is the longing for the half of ourselves we have lost." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf." -- George Orwell

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Run for your life from any man who tells you that money is evil. That sentence is the leper's bell of an approaching looter." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Dan add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The hardest thing to explain is the glaringly evident which everybody has decided not to see." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Dan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dan add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Dan add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Dan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Dan add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Dan add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Dan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dan add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Dan add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Dan add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "If you haven’t the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Dan add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "I prefer the company of peasants because they have not been educated sufficiently to reason incorrectly." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Dan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Pacifism is objectively pro-fascist. This is elementary common sense. If you hamper the war effort of one side, you automatically help out that of the other. Nor is there any real way of remaining outside such a war as the present one. In practice, 'he that is not with me is against me'." -- George Orwell

item.title: Dan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The majority of pacifists either belong to obscure religious sects or are simply humanitarians who object to taking life and prefer not to follow their thoughts beyond that point. But there is a minority of intellectual pacifists, whose real though unacknowledged motive appears to be hatred of western democracy and admiration for totalitarianism. Pacifist propaganda usually boils down to saying that one side is as bad as the other, but if one looks closely at the writing of the younger intellectual pacifists, one finds that they do not by any means express impartial disapproval but are directed almost entirely against Britain and the United States …" -- George Orwell

item.title: Dan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "To see what is in front of one’s nose needs a constant struggle." -- George Orwell

item.title: Dan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection." -- George Orwell
